nsmod 0.1 documentation

Nonlinear dynamics

Contents

Nonlinear dynamics¶

Spin down¶

Functions used for nonlinear dynamics calculations

lib.NLD_Functions.Attractor_Plot(file_name, elev=15.0, azim=150, save_fig=False, close=False)[source]¶

Plots the attractor associated with the data in file_name, essentially the same as Embed_Seymour_Lorimer but with additions. This function should be used in creating publication images then we can change the embedding if required.

Parameters:
  • elev (float) – view elevation
  • azim (float) – view azimuth
Returns:

A 3D plot of the attractor
lib.NLD_Functions.Embed_Seymour_Lorimer(time, x, n=False, frac=8, plot=False)[source]¶

Takes 1d signal x and produces a 3-dimensional embedding calculating the delay integer using the method of Seymour and Lorimer 2010.

Parameters:
  • x (list) – 1D signal to embed
  • time (list) – List of times at which x is sampled or the sampling time
  • n (int) – Specifies the number of delay times to search over, largest delay is given by \(n imes dt\) where \(dt\) is the uniform sampling rate
  • frac (int) – The fraction of data between 0 and the first minimum to be used in fitting a polynomial
  • plot – If true this will return two subplots showing the estimation of delay time :math:` au` and the embedding
Returns:

Embedded data
Return type:

Three lists
